file_insights.description: Added import statement for i18n configuration module
file_insights.purpose: Initialize internationalization configuration at application startup

patterns_discovered.description: i18n configuration is imported at the root entry point (main.tsx) to ensure it initializes before the application renders
Multiple context providers (ThemeProvider, ToastProvider) are stacked in the root component, with i18n initialization imported separately

gotchas_discovered.description: The i18n config import must occur before React component rendering to ensure translation resources are loaded
gotchas_discovered.resolution: Placed import at module level before ReactDOM.createRoot call

gotchas_discovered.description: Unlike ThemeProvider and ToastProvider which wrap the App component, i18n only requires a module-level import
gotchas_discovered.impact: Different initialization pattern than other app-level utilities

approach_outcome.description: Successfully initialized i18n in main.tsx with a single import statement
approach_outcome.key_achievement: Added i18n configuration import to ensure translation system is ready before application renders

recommendations.recommendation: Verify that i18n/config module properly initializes all language resources and can be imported without side effects during SSR if applicable
Document the i18n initialization pattern for team members to understand why i18n uses module-level import vs provider wrapper pattern
Add unit test to ensure i18n config loads before App component renders and translations are available
Consider adding a comment above the i18n import explaining its purpose and initialization timing
